column1: 2#A black-and-white head and shoulder shot of a man wearing coat and Jinnah cap.#Sir Khawaja Nazimuddin#17 October 1951#17 April 1953#1 Year
column3: #—#Muslim League##Nazimuddin became Prime Minister of Pakistan after the assassination of Liaquat Ali Khan in 1951. He left the office when Governor-General Malik Ghulam Muhammad dissolved his government in 1953.

column1: 3#A black-and-white head and shoulder shot of a man wearing white shirt and a black tie.#Mohammad Ali Bogra#17 April 1953#12 August 1955#2 Years

column1: 6##Ibrahim Ismail Chundrigar#17 October 1957#16 December 1957#1 Month

column1: 11#A head and shoulder shot of a woman in traditional Pakistani dress.#Benazir Bhutto#2 December 1988#6 August 1990#1 Year

column5: which was later on reinstated by the Supreme Court of Pakistan.

column1: 13#A head and shoulder shot of a woman in traditional Pakistani dress.#Benazir Bhutto#19 October 1993#5 November 1996#3 Years

column4: #2002#Pakistan Muslim League (Q)##Jamali was elected as the Prime Minister of Pakistan in November 2002. He continued the foreign and economic policies of Pervez Musharraf but could not complete his term and resigned from the post in June 2004.

column6: and became the first Prime Minister of Pakistan who left the seat after completion of parliamentary term.

column1: 18#A shot of a man during a meeting.#Yousaf Raza Gillani#25 March 2008#19 June 2012#4 Years
column3: 25 Days.#2008#Pakistan Peoples Party##Gillani was elected as prime minister in March 2008. He was disqualified from his seat in the parliament in April 2012 by the Supreme Court for contempt of court.

column1: 20#A head and shoulder shot of a man from the left.#Nawaz Sharif#5 June 2013#28 July 2017#4 Years
column5: Sharif took office for a third non-consecutive term. He was disqualified on 28 July 2017 by the Supreme Court of Pakistan as a result of the Panama Papers case.

column1: 21#-#Shahid Khaqan Abbasi#1 August 2017#31 May 2018#10 months#—#Pakistan Muslim League (N)##Parliament elected Shahid Khaqan Abbasi as the Prime Minister after the impeachment of Nawaz Sharif. His term expired on May 31
column2: 2018 alongside the dissolution of the National Assembly to facilitate a caretaker government in place until the 25 July general election.

column1: 22#-#Imran Khan#18 August 2018#Incumbent#251 days#2018#Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf##General elections were held on the 25th July 2018
column2: which resulted in the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf won in a landslide victory. On August 18
column4: Imran Khan was sworn in as Prime Minister.
